civil.title: Tabular / Islamic Civil (default)
civil.summary: A deterministic (algorithmic) Hijri calendar based on fixed arithmetic rules, not on local moon sighting.
civil.ch2: Months alternate 30/29 days; month 12 is 30 in leap years
civil.ch3: Conversion via Julian Day Number (JDN) rules
civil.pro1: Stable and predictable; no external data needed
civil.pro2: Works offline and is easy to test
civil.con1: May differ from official country calendars
civil.con2: Does not reflect actual crescent visibility

ummalqura.title: Umm al-Qura (Saudi official)
ummalqura.summary: A published official calendar used in Saudi Arabia. It usually requires trusted rules/data to match published results.
ummalqura.con1: Depends on a trusted dataset/library to be accurate
ummalqura.comingSoon: This method is planned but not enabled yet.

estimate.title: Astronomical visibility estimate (for probability)
estimate.summary: An astronomy-based estimator that answers two separate questions for each evening at your selected location.
estimate.ch1: Question 1 (observation): Is the crescent likely visible this evening?
estimate.ch2: Question 2 (calendar): How likely is the next Gregorian date to be Hijri day 1?
estimate.ch3: Uses a canonical scale: No chance / Very low / Low / Medium / High, with an exclusivity rule (if day X is Medium/High month-start signal, day X+1 is forced to No chance)
estimate.threshold1: No chance: lag <= 0 minutes (moon sets at/before sunset) OR moon altitude <= 0°.
estimate.threshold6: Exclusivity normalization: if day X month-start signal is Medium or High, day X+1 is forced to No chance (0%).
estimate.formula1: Each component is normalized linearly to [0..1]: altitude from 0°..10°, elongation from 6°..15°, age from 12h..24h, lag from 0..60 min.
estimate.formula4: Near-new-moon constraints are applied before final labeling (e.g., far from conjunction -> low/zero signal).
estimate.note: Important: this is an estimate, not an official religious announcement. The app uses sunset/evening astronomy metrics (moonset lag, altitude, elongation, age, illumination, and score) to derive a normalized month-start signal.

probability.label: Month start likelihood
probability.noChanceHint: Moon sets at/before sunset (no crescent possible).
probability.disclaimer: Month-start likelihood is an estimate for the evening (around local sunset) at the selected location. If the crescent is seen on this evening, the next Gregorian date becomes Hijri day 1.
probability.eveningEstimateHint: Estimate for this evening; it affects the next day after sunset.
probability.lowDesc: Low: Conditions are poor for a visible crescent (e.g., Moon very low/setting too soon, very small separation from the Sun, very young Moon, or wrong phase).
probability.mediumDesc: Medium: Borderline/mixed conditions; visibility depends on observer conditions and criteria.
probability.highDesc: High: Conditions are stronger (Moon higher, more separated from the Sun, older, and/or stays up longer after sunset).
